definition: to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

sentences.english: So I plan to buy a tutorial class for him during the holiday.
sentences.chinese: 所以我打算在這個假期給他報個輔導班。

sentences.english: Because what that's going to do is, it's going to  force  you to take practice exams.
sentences.chinese: 因爲在輔導班上，他們會讓你做許多的模考訓練。

sentences.english: Everybody basically signed up for coach class.
sentences.chinese: 大家基本上都報了輔導班。

sentences.english: The behavior that small favor gnaws a steamed bread midday was caused coach the attention of class teacher.
sentences.chinese: 小德中午啃饅頭的行爲引起了輔導班老師的注意。

sentences.english: Almost all Korean students in primary and high schools have attended tutorial classes.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎所有的韓國中小學生都有上輔導班的經歷。

sentences.english: The class coached to use nearly 2000 yuan on these two light.
sentences.chinese: 這兩項光上輔導班就用去了近2000元。

sentences.english: Some organizations offer intensive courses that last two orthree days.
sentences.chinese: 一些輔導班會開設兩至三天的密集訓練營。

definition: student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
(of a student) to work part-time (while continuing one's studies)/(of a delinquent) to be reformed through work and study
